main module

class main.VTTAnalyzer[source]

Bases: Tk

create_widgets()[source]

Create and pack the widgets in the scrollable frame.

generate_ab_summary()[source]

Generate an abstractive summary from the loaded VTT content. This function checks if the summary has been previously generated. If not, it processes the content and generates the summary. The summary is then displayed in the GUI.

generate_ex_summary()[source]

Generate an extractive summary from the loaded VTT content. This function checks if the summary has been previously generated. If not, it processes the content, generates the summary, and formats it. The summary is then displayed in the GUI.

insert_text(text)[source]

Insert text into the summary box widget, allowing modifications only during the update. The function also handles enabling buttons based on the content being displayed, depending on whether it matches predefined summaries for extractive or abstractive analysis results.

Args:

text (str): The text to be inserted into the summary box.

on_mouse_wheel(event)[source]

Handle mouse wheel events to scroll the canvas vertically. This method adjusts the vertical view of the canvas based on the mouse wheel movement.

Args:

event: An event object containing information about the mouse wheel action.

open_file()[source]

Open a file dialog to allow the user to select a VTT file and then load its content into the application. Upon loading, the function will update the interface to reflect the loaded file and enable further analysis options.

openai_summary()[source]

Generate a summary using an OpenAI model and print it.

setup_scrollable_window()[source]

Setup the main window with a vertical scrollbar and a canvas for scrolling. This function initializes a canvas and a scrollbar and binds them to create a scrollable frame that fills the main window. It also sets up mouse wheel scrolling for the frame and initiates the widget creation process.

show_plot(plot_function)[source]

Display a matplotlib plot in the GUI. This method generates a plot using a provided function and data, then integrates it into the scrollable canvas area of the interface.

Args:

plot_function (function): A function that takes a DataFrame and returns a matplotlib figure.

update_scroll_region()[source]

Update the scroll region of the canvas. This method is called after adding or resizing content within the scrollable area to ensure that the entire content is accessible through scrolling.
